Package model

Class AiPlayer

java.lang.Object
model.Player
model.AiPlayer
public class AiPlayer extends Player
The class AiPlayer extends the class Player and represents a generic virtual player in a card game.
Author:
Simone

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    AiPlayer.Strategy
    The enumeration Strategy represents possible strategy of virtual player

  • Constructor Details

    • AiPlayer

      public AiPlayer(String aiName, AiPlayer.Strategy aiStrategy)
      AiPlayer constructor with aiName and aiStrategy field as parameter
      Parameters:
      aiName - the string name of virtual player
      aiStrategy - the Strategy enumeration of virtual player

  • Method Details

    • play

      public Card play(Card rejected)
      Auto plays a card in a card game.
      Parameters:
      rejected - a card that has been the last rejected
      Returns:
      the card played, or null if no card can be played (card must be drawn)

    • getAiStrategy

      public AiPlayer.Strategy getAiStrategy()
      Gets the current strategy for a virtual player.
      Returns:
      the player's current strategy

    • setAiStrategy

      public void setAiStrategy(AiPlayer.Strategy aiStrategy)
      Sets the strategy for a virtual player.
      Parameters:
      aiStrategy - the new strategy for virtual player

    • autoChooseCard

      public Card autoChooseCard(List<Card> validCards, Card rejected)
      Chooses a card to play based on the player's strategy and the rejected card.
      Parameters:
      validCards - a list of cards that are valid to play
      rejected - the card that was rejected and cannot be played
      Returns:
      the chosen card to play, or null if no card can be played

    • autoChooseColor

      public Card.Color autoChooseColor()
      Automatically chooses a color for a wild card based on the player's hand.

      If the player's hand contains no cards other than wild cards, a random color is chosen. Otherwise, the color with the most representation in the player's hand is chosen.

      Returns:
      the chosen color
      See Also:
      • Card.Color
      • Card.isWild()
      • Card.isWildFour()
